item.title: 2D Arrays and Pointers in C
item.description: Before Starting: basic understanding of memory address & pointers in C: https://www.w3schools.com/c/c_memory_address.php https://www.w3schools.com/c/c_pointers.php 2D arrays in C an online IDE with compiler that might come in handy: jdoodle C What’s the Issue? Let’s understand the problem first, here’s a C code snippet with bugs. #include<stdio.h> void traverse(int **matrix, size_t row_len, size_t col_len){ for (int i = 0; i < row_len; i++){ for (int j = 0; j < col_len; j++){ printf("%d ", matrix[i][j]); } printf("\n"); } } int main(void) { int matrix[3][3] = { {0, 1, 0}, {0, 0, 1}, {0, 1, 0} }; traverse(matrix, 3, 3); } Simply copy and paste and run it.
